Comments_List: I improved many of my musical skills from taking this course.  The many exercises in dictation and sight-singing of both pitches and rhythms as well as the exercises in score reading and improvisation were very effective.
I bettered my aural music theory skills. I improved my accuracy in health information chord progressions and changes in mode. I learned how to transcribe music using a variety of techniques.

The assignments for this class were very effective in helping students train their musical abilities, and keyboard lab in general was a great exercise, but it seemed that much of the class time was not spent very productively, almost as if it was not necessary.  There was definitely more that could have been covered that would have improved the course rather than covering things already covered in Music 210 and Music 211.

The homework assigned was very helpful in practicing the techniques discussed in class, however, I felt I needed more practice. I also felt afraid to ask questions when I didn't understand things, as most other people in the class se mand r to comprehend thins right away.

Aside from music majors who are required to take it, I would only recommend this course to people who are dedicated to improving their musical skills and prepared to actually practice these skills.  There is a deceptive amount of work in preparing much of the material.
I do recommend this for prospective music majors or people who have an interest in music composition.
